message.title: JRuby 1.6/0.5.2 beta released
message.short: The new 1.6/0.5.2 development version is released today.

text.p: Proudly announcing the new beta version 1.6/0.5.2 of JRuby.

Since the latest version 1.6/0.5.1 a lot has happened. All this is available in the new Version 1.6/0.5.2, which is available at: http://sourceforge.net/project/showfiles.php?group_id=35413&release_id=114834
Note: JRuby is still BETA software. If it breaks you get to keep both pieces.

message.title: JRuby 1.6/0.5.1 beta released
message.short: The new 1.6/0.5.1 development version is released today.

text.p: Proudly announcing a new version of JRuby:

Since our latest release in May we have made lots of progress. All of this is in our new beta release 1.6/0.5.1, available at http://sourceforge.net/project/showfiles.php?group_id=35413&release_id=104911
Note: JRuby is still BETA software. In particular, the thread support may (will) have bad interactions with other threads when JRuby is embedded.

message.title: JRuby 1.6/0.5.0 beta released
message.short: The new 1.6/0.5.0 beta development version is released today.

ul.li: Improved parser and lexer. New evaluator.
Improved support for builtin classes (Marhsal, pack, unpack, rand, srand, |, ^, `, each_byte, to_f, each_value, each_key, proc, sort, invert, join, dirname).
Improved Java support (automatically convert numeric types). Use always the real Java class and not the declared type.

message.title: New Homepage
message.short: A new design and more information.

long.p: Not all pages are created yet.
We also need some help to create documentation. If you want to help please contact .

message.title: JRuby 1.6/0.3.1 released
message.short: The new 1.6/0.3.1 beta development version is released today.
message.long: There are a lot of new builtin classes and methods implemented to reach a better Ruby 1.6 compatibility. Also the Java integration support improved. For example you can access public methods now.

message.title: Swing example added
message.long: Add a Swing example to JRuby 0.2.2. You should also view the new Java support .
